comorbidities: ['ductal hyperplasia of the breast', 'common variable immunodeficiency syndrome (CVID)', 'asthma', 'obstructive sleep apnea', 'thyroid follicular cancer']
comorbidities_quote: A 61-year-old female with a history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast, common variable immunode /uniFB01 ciency syndrome (CVID), asthma, obstructive sleep apnea, and thyroid follicular cancer
symptoms_quote: diagnosed with diffuse pulmonary nodules incidentally via CT angiogram chest
diagnostic_method: ['CT angiogram chest', 'CT scan chest', 'bronchoscopy', 'bronchioalveolar lavage', 'transbronchial cryo biopsy', 'immunostaining']
diagnostic_method_quote: diagnosed with diffuse pulmonary nodules incidentally via CT angiogram chest... The patient eventually underwent bronchoscopy with bronchioalveolar lavage (BAL) with transbronchial cryo biopsy of lung nodules, which showed MPMNs with further immunostaining negative for malignancy.
laboratory_findings: ['chronic neutropenia with lymphocytosis', 'positive perinuclear and cytoplasmic antineutrophil cytoplasmic (PANCA & CANCA) antibody', 'negative antinuclear (ANA)', 'negative myeloperoxidase (MPO)', 'negative proteinase 3 (PR3)']
laboratory_findings_quote: Labs demonstrated chronic neutropenia with lymphocytosis, positive perinuclear and cytoplasmic antineutrophil cytoplasmic (PANCA & CANCA) antibody, but negative antinuclear (ANA), myeloperoxidase (MPO), and proteinase 3 (PR3).
imaging_findings: numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular ground glass nodules and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance
imaging_findings_quote: CT scan chest 1 year later showed numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular GGNs and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance.
treatment_plan: close follow-up with serial CT scans
treatment_plan_quote: given the complexity of the case, lack of symptoms, and stability of nodules, a decision was made for close follow-up with serial CT scans.
diagnosis_quote: In our case, the patient was diagnosed with DPM, which is an exceptionally rare form of widespread MPMs with few cases reported in the literature.
differential_diagnosis: ['malignant nodules', 'atypical infection', 'autoimmune interstitial lung disease (ILD)', 'granulomatous lymphocytic interstitial lung disease (GLI-ILD)']
differential_diagnosis_quote: Differentials at the time of diagnosis included malignant nodules, atypical infection, autoimmune interstitial lung disease (ILD), and granulomatous lymphocytic interstitial lung disease (GLI-ILD).
paper_type_quote: SESSION TYPE: Rapid Fire Case Reports
mpnn_course_nature_quote: Although MPMNs usually have an indolent course

patient_age_quote: A 63-year-old woman was referred for dedicated chest CT imaging
sex_quote: A 63-year-old woman was referred for dedicated chest CT imaging
symptoms_quote: abdominal CT scan performed for evaluation of diarrhea
diagnostic_method_quote: Chest CT showed numerous small ( , 6 mm), rounded, ground-glass, randomly distributed nodules... Right lower lobe transbronchial cryobiopsy histopathologic findings revealed nodular cellular proliferation... Immunohistochemistry with positive staining for epithelial membrane antigen and progesterone receptor
imaging_findings: numerous small (< 6 mm), rounded, ground-glass, randomly distributed nodules with no lobe spared. Some nodules showed central lucencies with a ringlike appearance
imaging_findings_quote: Chest CT showed numerous small ( , 6 mm), rounded, ground-glass, randomly distributed nodules with no lobe spared. Some nodules showed central lucencies with a ringlike appearance.
diagnosis_quote: Immunohistochemistry with positive staining for epithelial membrane antigen and progesterone receptor, but negative staining for neuroendocrine markers such as synaptophysin, confirmed our diagnosis.
differential_diagnosis: ['adenocarcinoma in situ', 'carcinoid tumor', 'tumorlets', 'nonfibrotic hypersensitivity pneumonitis', 'vasculitis', 'atypical infection']
differential_diagnosis_quote: MPMNs usually follow a benign, indolent course but may mimic adenocarcinoma in situ, carcinoid tumor and tumorlets, nonfibrotic hypersensitivity pneumonitis, vasculitis, or atypical infection.
nodules_size_quote: numerous small ( , 6 mm), rounded, ground-glass, randomly distributed nodules
nodules_distribution: random distribution through both lungs with no lobe spared
nodules_distribution_quote: randomly distributed nodules with no lobe spared
histopathologic_findings: nodular cellular proliferation expanding the interstitium with whorllike appearance
histopathologic_findings_quote: Right lower lobe transbronchial cryobiopsy histopathologic findings revealed nodular cellular proliferation expanding the interstitium with whorllike appearance
immunohistochemistry_results: ['positive for epithelial membrane antigen', 'positive for progesterone receptor', 'negative for neuroendocrine markers (synaptophysin)']
immunohistochemistry_results_quote: Immunohistochemistry with positive staining for epithelial membrane antigen and progesterone receptor, but negative staining for neuroendocrine markers such as synaptophysin
